newsitem.title: UK: UK wool sale attracts keen interest.
newsitem.headline: UK wool sale attracts keen interest.

text.p: The last sale of the season was held in Bradford when the Committee of London Wool Brokers acting on behalf of the British Wool Marketing Board offered a total of approximately 2,041,432 million kilos of British Wool.
Good competition on an end of season offering with forward wools attracting keen interest resulted in over 90 percent clearance.

Compared with the last sale at Bradford on April 30 Picks and Supers moved in buyers' favour. Halfbreds were at par to 2.5 percent dearer and Mashams were fully 2.5 percent dearer. Crosses were up to 23.5 percent dearer as were Radnors except Grey Radnor which was fully 5 percent dearer. Welsh were 5 percent dearer. Swaledale was fully firm except Grey Swaledale which was 5 percent dearer.
